The $cA_{1}$ time series approximates the underlying low-frequency trend of $x(t)$ (average coefficients), while the $cD_{1}$ time series represents a higher frequency component (detail coefficients). They are down-sampled by a factor of 2 (``$\downarrow 2$'' in Equations \ref{eqn_A1} and \ref{eqn_D1}) with respect to the original time series, because of the Nyquist theorem.\\
It is possible to apply the $g$ and $h$ filters to the $cA_{1}$ time series, then obtaining new sets of coefficients, $cA_{2}$ and $cD_{2}$, and iterate the process. The n-level DWT includes the $cA_{n}$ series of average coefficients, down-sampled by a factor of 2$^n$, and n series $cD_{1}$-$cD_{n}$ of detail coefficients, representing bands of higher frequencies.

The original data can be reconstructed by reversing the process:
